title_sort: william stansberry to walt whitman, 21 july 1875
title: William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 21 July 1875
text: Howard Lake, MinnMinnesotaJuly 21, 1875My Dear Friend WaltI was glad to hear from you But Sory[Sorry] to know that your Health was not Improving But gladd that you remember me My health's Failig[Failing] Fast as I have told you In letter Before that I am trying for an Envelid[Invalid] Pentian[Pension] I have Now only the Need of to welnesses[wellness] of my Comrades they Live in W. VaWest Virginia and if as is an have Been in the habit of Asisting[Assisting] Soldier People I would Like to have the Love of 65th until Next Aprilth Want to go to W VaWest Virginia and get those witnesses I will Pay you Intrest Let me know at once If you Please, I can not find out their adress[address] and to get then[them] I must go to West. W. V.aWest Virginia M D Halans is my Pentian[Pension] agent St. Paul MinnMinnesota Howard Lake is Improving Fast I wished you would come and visit this place My wife sends her Best wishes with mineWrite soonWm StansberyWm StansberyJuly '75 William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 21 July 1875
